segment: Use of Cookies   Sci-News.com uses cookie technology. A cookie is a small amount of data, which often includes a unique identifier that is sent to your computer or mobile phone browser from a websites computer and is stored on your devices hard drive. A website can send its own cookie to your browser if your browsers preferences allow it, but your browser only permits a website to access the cookies it has already sent to you, not the cookies sent to you by other websites. Many websites do this whenever a user visits their website in order to track online traffic flows.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of cookies by Sci-News.com to track online traffic flows, indicating collection of data on their website.

segment: During the course of any visit to the Sci-News.com website, the pages you see, along with a cookie, are downloaded to your device. A website does this because cookies enable a publisher to find out whether the device has visited the website before. This is done on a repeat visit by checking to see, and finding, the cookie left there on the last visit.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of cookies to track whether a device has visited the website before, which involves collecting cookies and tracking elements implicitly when a user visits the site. The purpose is related to service operation and security to recognize returning users.

segment: Please note that during or after your visits to the Sci-News.com website you may notice some cookies that are not related to it. Sci-News.com does not control the dissemination of these cookies. You must check the third party websites for more information about these.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that third parties may place cookies on users' devices while visiting the Sci-News.com website, suggesting third party collection on the first party's website.

segment: You may refuse to accept cookies by activating the setting on your browser which allows you to refuse the setting of cookies. However, if you select this setting you may be unable to access certain parts of the site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the option for users to refuse cookies by adjusting their browser settings, which falls under browser/device privacy controls.

segment: Disclosure of Your Information   Sci-News.com does not sell, trade or rent your personal information to third parties. If we choose to do so in the future, you will be notified by email of our intentions, and have the right to be removed prior to the disclosure.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment clearly states that Sci-News.com does not sell, trade, or rent personal information to third parties, indicating a 'Does Not' action regarding third-party sharing.

segment: Your Consent and Rights   By using Sci-News.com, you consent to the collection and use, in accordance with this policy, of the information you provide to us.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates that by using the service, users consent to the collection and use of their information, which implies a form of user choice or control regarding first-party data collection.
